data.title: Vittorio Amadeo Francesco Savoy (1666-1732)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Vittorio Amedeo Savoy born 1666 Torino, Piemonte, Ducato di Savoia (Duchy of Savoy) died 1732 Torino, Piemonte, Ducato di Savoia including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 9 Aug 2022 | Created 28 Sep 2014

This page has been accessed 2,060 times.

Vittorio Amedeo Savoy is a member of the House of Savoy.

Biography

Preceded by

Charles V HRE King of Sardinia

17 February 1720 – 3 September 1730 Succeeded by

Charles Emmanuel III of Sardinia

Victor Amadeus II of Savoy (Vittorio Amadeo) was Duke of Savoy from 1675 to 1730. He was for a time the King of Sicily and the King of Sardinia.

He was born in 1666 in Turin, Savoy (then a fief of the Holy Roman Empire). He became the Duke of Savoy in 1675 upon the death of his father Carlo Emmannuele II. His mother Marie-Jeanne-Baptiste, Duchess of Savoy, was regent of Savoy until 1684.

In 1614, Victor Amadeus married Anne-Marie d'Orléans of France, daughter of Philippe I, Duke of Orléans.

In the War of the Spanish Succession (1701-1714), Victor Amadeus initially allied himself with France. He fought in the Battle of Chiari (Lombardy) in 1701. In 1703 he switched sides and allied himself with Leopold I, the Holy Roman Emperor. As a result, he was made King of Sicily under the Treaty of Utrecht which ended the war.

In 1720 he was forced to exchange Sicily for Sardinia and became King of Sardinia. He abdicated in 1730.

His first wife Queen Anne-Marie died in 1728. Victor Amadeus married Anna Canalis di Cumiana in 1730 in Turin.

He passed away in 1732 and was buried in the Convent of San Giuseppe di Carignano.

Sources

Wikipedia: Victor Amadeus II of Sardinia.
